com.skoev.timer
Class TimerPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.skoev.timer.TimerPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class TimerPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This class contains the application's view state and view logic. It contains a number of javax.swing components, which render the view, take input from the user, and fire events when certain user actions are performed. Some of these components are displayed in secondary application windows (aboutFrame, lockSettingsFrame, and soundSettingsFrame) so that the main widow is not too cluttered.

This class contains little or no application logic; the application state and logic are handled by timerControl.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

initComponents

private void initComponents()
This method is called from within the constructor to initialize the form; its contents are generated automatically by the Form Editor in Netbeans, where javax.swing components were instanced, positioned, and wired to event listeners graphically.

initManualComponents

private void initManualComponents()
This method is called from within the constructor to initialize the javax.swing components in the form from values in the application's controller TimerControl; its conents are written manually. It also instantiates a javax.Swing.Timer component that fires every 1000ms and wires it to an event listener; this component is the source of timing for the application.

timerActionPerformed

private void timerActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
Event listener for the swingTimer object. When that object fires and event, this method calls the TimerControl.decrementTimer() method.

updateOutputs

private void updateOutputs()
A convenience method to update the workTimeOutput and breakTimeOutput from the values in the timerControl

updateSoundSettings

private void updateSoundSettings()
A convenience method to update the useSampledAudio, useToolkitBeep, useBeeper, soundFrequency, and soundDuration from values in timerControl

setInputsEnabled

private void setInputsEnabled(boolean value)
This method disables some of the inputs while the timer is working and displays a message that the timer must be stopped in order to change settings.

startButtonActionPerformed

private void startButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
Event listener for the startButton component. When the start button is pressed, the start button becomes a stop button and the timer is started. When the stop button is pressed, the stop button becomes a start button and the timer is stopped.

beginRecordingKeyPressed

private void beginRecordingKeyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt)
If the begnRecording key (beginRecording) button has been pressed, this method saves all the keyboard keystrokes.
